statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.name: offensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

article.headline: Cent. Connecticut St. 66, UMBC 52
article.story: CATONSVILLE, Md. (AP) -- Tristan Blackwood scored 24 points and Central Connecticut State hit a season-high 13 3-pointers in a 66-52 victory over Maryland-Baltimore County on Saturday. Blackwood matched his career high with six 3-pointers, helping the Blue Devils (4-9) break a four-game losing streak and notch their fifth straight victory over the Retrievers (4-9). The 13 3s, in 22 attempts, were tied for the sixth-most in school history. Brian Hodges scored 18 points for UMBC, which has lost a season-high four straight, and Justin Fry added 10. Joe Seymore scored 15 points and Obie Nwadike had 14 points and 12 rebounds for the Blue Devils, who hit only eight of 30 two-point attempts. Javier Mojica hit a 3-pointer from the left corner, and Blackwood made two from the left side to ignite a 20-4 run that gave the Blue Devils a 49-35 lead with 13:04 remaining. UMBC used a 13-3 run midway through the first half to erase an early 16-10 deficit. Hodges had nine points during the spurt, which included consecutive dunks by Chris Seaborn. But Blackwood's 3-pointer with 4.2 seconds left, Central Connecticut's fifth 3 of the half, put the visitors up 29-27 at halftime.
